text:
Raskolnikov followed Svidrigaïlov closely. 

“What’s this?” Svidrigaïlov turned, surprised. 

“I’m not losing sight of you,” Raskolnikov replied. 

“Not losing sight?” 

They stood still, measuring each other. 

“Your stories are half-tipsy lies. You want my sister,” Raskolnikov said. 

Svidrigaïlov smirked. “I’ll call the police!” 

“Call away!” 

Silence hung between them. 

Svidrigaïlov’s expression shifted. 

“Curiosity devours me,” he said, grinning. 

Raskolnikov felt uncertain, his thoughts tangled.

**PAGE SUMMARY:** Raskolnikov confronts Svidrigaïlov about his intentions towards his sister, expressing suspicion and a desire for clarity.
